item.title: Playing with the openqa API
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: Today we are going to play a bit around with the amazing API that every openQA instance provides. The aim of this tutorial is to show how the API can be accessed using a simple language like python.

item.title: Hidden gem - Show failures only in external results
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: I just recently discovered one of the hidden gems in the openQA WebUI: Show only failing tests in external results. Problem / User story Certain tests like ltp perform a series of tests within a test run and show the results as “External results”.

item.title: Active monitoring of openQA jobs
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: openqa-mon is a little command-line utility to monitor one or multiple openQA jobs for their status. This tool is useful if you want to live monitor a handful of jobs closely e.

item.title: What are Needles
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: In this blog post we are going to give you the easiest introduction to what needles are and how you can use them. While there are many good talks and documentation on needles out there, it took me longer than it should have to find a easy-to-use and easy-to-understand introduction into this topic alone.
